entry.title: ‘Weyl-Kondo semimetal’: Physicists discover new type of quantum material

link.title: 'Weyl-Kondo semimetal': Physicists discover new type of quantum material

entry.content:
Extract

U.S. and European physicists searching for an explanation for high-temperature superconductivity were surprised when their theoretical model pointed to the existence of a never-before-seen material in a different realm of physics: topological quantum materials….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract U.S. and European physicists searching for an explanation for high-temperature superconductivity were surprised when their theoretical model pointed to the existence of a never-before-seen material in a different realm of physics: topological quantum materials….

entry.title: The bizarre world of topological materials

link.title: The bizarre world of topological materials

entry.content:
Extract

In 2016, three physicists received the Nobel Prize for using the mathematical concept of “topology” to explain the strange behavior of certain materials—for example, those that are insulators in their bulk but conductors on their surface. Now, researchers are investigating applications for these exotic materials in electronics, catalysis and quantum computing, according to an article in Chemical & Engineering News (C&EN), the weekly news magazine of the American Chemical Society….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract In 2016, three physicists received the Nobel Prize for using the mathematical concept of “topology” to explain the strange behavior of certain materials—for example, those that are insulators in their bulk but conductors on their surface. Now, researchers are investigating applications for these exotic materials in electronics, catalysis and quantum computing, according to an article in Chemical & Engineering News (C&EN), the weekly news magazine of the American Chemical Society….

entry.title: Single-photon detector can count to 4
entry.content:
Extract

(Duke University) Engineers have shown that a widely used method of detecting single photons can also count the presence of at least four photons at a time. The researchers say this discovery will unlock new capabilities in physics labs working in quantum information science around the world, while providing easier paths to developing quantum-based technologies….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract (Duke University) Engineers have shown that a widely used method of detecting single photons can also count the presence of at least four photons at a time. The researchers say this discovery will unlock new capabilities in physics labs working in quantum information science around the world, while providing easier paths to developing quantum-based technologies….

entry.title: Researchers develop silicon chip-based quantum photonic devices

link.title: Researchers develop silicon chip-based quantum photonic devices

entry.content:
Extract

An international team of researchers, affiliated with UNIST has presented a core technology for quantum photonic devices used in quantum information processing. They have proposed combining of quantum dots for generating light and silicon photonic technologies for manipulating light on a single device….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract An international team of researchers, affiliated with UNIST has presented a core technology for quantum photonic devices used in quantum information processing. They have proposed combining of quantum dots for generating light and silicon photonic technologies for manipulating light on a single device….

entry.title: ​Google Doubles Down on Linux and Open Source

link.title: ​Google Doubles Down on Linux and Open Source

entry.content:
Extract

Google couldn’t exist without Linux and open-source software. While you may not think of Google as a Linux company in the same way as you do Canonical, Red Hat, or SUSE, it wouldn’t be the search and advertising giant it is today without Linux. So, it makes sense that Google is moving up from its Silver membership in The Linux Foundation, to the Platinum level….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract Google couldn’t exist without Linux and open-source software. While you may not think of Google as a Linux company in the same way as you do Canonical, Red Hat, or SUSE, it wouldn’t be the search and advertising giant it is today without Linux. So, it makes sense that Google is moving up from its Silver membership in The Linux Foundation, to the Platinum level….

entry.title: Controlling photons with a photon
entry.content:
Extract

Photons are considered to be ideal information carriers and expected to play important roles in quantum communication and information processing, where quantum mechanics allows for absolutely secure cryptographic key distribution as well as computation much faster than conventional computers. In order to take full advantage of quantum information carried by photons, it is important to make them directly interact with each other for information processing….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract Photons are considered to be ideal information carriers and expected to play important roles in quantum communication and information processing, where quantum mechanics allows for absolutely secure cryptographic key distribution as well as computation much faster than conventional computers. In order to take full advantage of quantum information carried by photons, it is important to make them directly interact with each other for information processing….

entry.title: Complete design of a silicon quantum computer chip unveiled

link.title: Complete design of a silicon quantum computer chip unveiled

entry.content:
Extract

Research teams all over the world are exploring different ways to design a working computing chip that can integrate quantum interactions. Now, UNSW engineers believe they have cracked the problem, reimagining the silicon microprocessors we know to create a complete design for a quantum computer chip that can be manufactured using mostly standard industry processes and components….

Visit Link
entry.summary: Extract Research teams all over the world are exploring different ways to design a working computing chip that can integrate quantum interactions. Now, UNSW engineers believe they have cracked the problem, reimagining the silicon microprocessors we know to create a complete design for a quantum computer chip that can be manufactured using mostly standard industry processes and components….

entry.title: CMS releases more than one petabyte of open data

link.title: CMS releases more than one petabyte of open data

entry.content:
Extract

The CMS Collaboration at CERN have just made public around half of the data collected in 2012 by the CMS detector at the Large Hadron Collider. This release includes sets used to discover the Higgs boson, and is being shared through the CERN Open Data portal….
